column1: Online TransactionPay Online   Link to External Website
General guidelines for those seeking a baby-sitter
Links to the community database holding details of independently run badminton clubs within the Borough
• Balances
To query your council tax, business rates, debtors, former tenant arrears, poll tax or mortgage balance on-line
Links to the community database holding details of Baptist Churches within the Borough
• Barbers/Hairdressers Licence
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Basketball clubs within the Borough
Information for anyone having difficulties overcoming problems with bathing due to mobility problems
• Baths
Tameside's sports facilities are managed by Tameside Sports Trust

Tameside Council has been awarded Beacon Status for Reducing Crime and Disorder, Accessible Services, Maintaining a Quality Environment, Community Legal Services and more recently Getting Closer to Communities.
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Beekeeping Organisations within the Borough
Frequently asked questions and an online form to report Benefit Fraud
A formal economic twinning link between Tameside MBC and Bengbu Municipal People's Government in Anhui Province, People's Republic of China was forged in the early 1990's
The Council provides cemeteries at Ashton, Audenshaw, Denton, Droylsden, Dukinfield, Hyde, Mossley and Mottram and a crematorium at Dukinfield
The 2005/08 Corporate Plan is, in accordance with Government guidelines, our annual Best Value Performance Plan
• Better Care Higher Standards

The Charter for Long Term Care tells people needing long term care and support what standards of service they can expect from Tameside Social Care and Health Services (formerly Social Services), local health services and Tameside housing
Page Last Updated: (Last updated: 15-Sep-2006)
• Bins
Frequently asked questions regarding the refuse collection service, to query date of your domestic refuse collection or to report problems with the service
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Bird/Canary clubs within the Borough
• Birth Certificates
Born in Tameside? You can apply on-line for a copy birth certificate
Information covering antenatal care, benefits, health issues and the birth registration process.
• Black and Minority Ethnic Communities
Information for Health and Social Care Workers on how Tameside Social Care and Health is supporting the cultural and language needs of these communities
We can offer support to children, adults and their families/carers
Frequently asked questions about blocked drains or sewers
• Blue Badge Scheme
Formerly the Orange Badge Scheme - disabled parking scheme for disabled and blind persons
• Blue Badge Tourist Guides
For details of blue badge guided walks around Tameside
• Blue Bins
For details of the Council's waste paper recycling scheme and dates of collection rounds
Sited around Tameside over 60 blue plaques mark historic places
To report problems with illuminated bollards
• Book of Remembrance
Information regarding inscriptions in the book of remembrance at Dukinfield Crematorium
• Book Start
Encouraging parents to share books with babies and young children, free books and information packs available

Use our on-line library catalogue to search for books, make reservations or check your library account. You can also find out about "In Touch Tameside", Computer learning Centres and our new Books to Go service.
• Books for Sale
To view the catalogue of publications for sale on-line
• Bottle Bins/Banks
The Council is committed to recycling - full a full list of facilities in the area
Frequently asked questions about bowling green & club facilities in the area
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Boxing clubs within the Borough
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Boys Brigade clubs within the Borough
A confidential service to young people and their families who are seeking advice and assistance around substance use.
For details of the annual Whit Friday brass band competition
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Bridge clubs within the Borough
• Bridges, Structures and Retaining Walls
For details of maintenance and to report problems/damage
More information on Bridleways in Tameside can be obtained from our Countryside Service on 0161 330 9613, or Environmental Services on 0161 342 2920
The Council has introduced a scheme for the collection of garden waste.
A brownfield site is any land which has previously been used for any purpose and is no longer in use
• Building Control
For details of planning and building regulations, how to apply for planning permission and the list of planning applications
• Buildings for Sale
For details of council owned properties and land for sale and shops to let
• Bulky Household Refuse
We will remove up to 5 items such as furniture and cookers for a small charge
Miss School - Miss Out. School attendance matters
• Burglar Alarm Registration
Register your burglar alarm on-line and help us, and maybe yourself save money
The Council provides cemeteries at Ashton, Audenshaw, Denton, Droylsden, Dukinfield, Hyde, Mossley and Mottram
• Burst Pipes
Water bursts are dealt with by United Utilities - Leakline 0800 330033
Quality bus corridors - helping to provide an improved public transport system that will provide a viable alternative to the car
• Bus Passes
Details of free bus passes available in Tameside
• Bus Shelters
Links to GMPTE's web site. Contact: Head of Bus Station Services, GMPTE, 9 Portalnd Street, Piccadilly Gardens, Manchester, M60 1HX tel: 0161 242 6930
• Buses
Links to GMPTE's web site detailing timetables for local buses, trains and trams
• Business Rates
Frequently asked questions, direct debit scheme, on-line forms for payments and change of occupancy etc..
• Business Services
For advice and information for business and investors
Still not found what you are looking for? Try our Search or our A to Z of Services:
